columns.column_description: Primary key for the account record; uniquely distinguishes each customer account in the core ledger [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
Foreign-key reference to fixed_customers.id identifying the owner of the account; enables customer-level aggregation of balances and activity [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
Links the account to the servicing branch (fixed_branches.id) for branch-level P&L, liquidity, and regulatory reporting [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
ISO-4217 code denoting the currency in which the balance is maintained; ties to fixed_currencies.code for FX processing [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
Current monetary balance of the account, stored as a string to preserve precision before casting in calculations [schema.json.txt].

tables.business_process_overview: Anchors all deposit and lending products. Balances feed daily GL, liquidity management, risk models, and customer statements.

columns.column_description: Unique identifier for each payment card issued by the bank [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
References the funding account (accounts.id) used to authorise card transactions [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
Business classification of the card such as 'debit' or 'credit' for product segmentation and fee logic [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].

tables.business_process_overview: Supports card-issuance, authorisation routing, and fraud analytics by linking plastic to the underlying deposit or credit account.

columns.column_description: Primary key representing an organisational department within the bank [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Human-readable department name used in HR and cost-centre reporting [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].

tables.business_process_overview: Provides the organisational hierarchy supporting employee HR records, cost allocation, and internal audit trails.

columns.column_description: Unique identifier for an employee record in HR systems [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Foreign key to departments.id indicating the employee’s organisational unit [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Identifies the branch location (fixed_branches.id) where the employee is stationed, used for staffing and payroll allocations [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].

tables.business_process_overview: Captures staff assignments for operational oversight, compliance roles (e.g., tellers vs. advisors), and branch capacity planning.

columns.column_description: Primary key for the audit record ensuring immutability and traceability [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
Entity type that was acted upon (e.g., 'accounts', 'transactions') for audit categorisation [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
Identifier of the specific record impacted, enabling point-in-time reconstruction [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
CRUD action performed: create, update, or delete [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
UTC date-time when the action occurred for regulatory audit trails [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].

tables.business_process_overview: Provides immutable logs required for SOX, GDPR, and internal control attestations.

columns.column_description: Unique identifier for a physical banking branch [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
Marketing or legal name of the branch location [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
ISO-3166 alpha-2 code of the branch’s jurisdiction, used for localisation and regulatory reporting [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].

tables.business_process_overview: Reference table for branch master data supporting account servicing, HR assignments, and cross-border compliance.

columns.column_description: ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code serving as primary key [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Official country name for UI display and regulatory filings [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].

tables.business_process_overview: Canonical list of countries used across KYC, FX, and cross-border transaction screening.

columns.column_description: ISO-4217 currency code acting as primary key [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Full currency name for statements and regulatory disclosures [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].

tables.business_process_overview: Master list of supported currencies enabling multi-currency accounting, FX trading, and reporting.

columns.column_description: Primary key uniquely identifying each customer across all products [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
Legal full name used for contracts and KYC screening [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
Preferred electronic contact channel for statements and alerts [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
Date of birth required for identity verification and age-based product eligibility [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
Residence country (fixed_country_ref.code) for tax and AML obligations [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].

tables.business_process_overview: Core customer registry powering onboarding, KYC/AML, marketing segmentation, and consolidated statements.

columns.column_description: Unique identifier of the FX rate snapshot [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Base currency of the rate (fixed_currencies.code) [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Quote currency to which the base converts [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Mid-market conversion rate stored as string for precision (e.g., 1 USD = 147.32 JPY) [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].

tables.business_process_overview: Supplies daily FX rates for multi-currency balance translation, fee calculations, and regulatory reports.

columns.column_description: Primary key for each financial product offering [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Marketing name of the product (e.g., 'Secure Savings Account') used in customer-facing channels [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].

tables.business_process_overview: Product catalogue referenced by accounts, loans, and holdings to standardise fees, features, and disclosures.

columns.column_description: References transactions.id that triggered a fraud rule [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Categorical reason for the flag (e.g., 'high amount', 'suspicious location') [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].

tables.business_process_overview: Captures rule-based or ML-based alerts feeding manual review queues and real-time transaction holds.

columns.column_description: Primary key for a customer’s investment or deposit holding record [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Owner of the holding (fixed_customers.id) [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Financial product represented (fixed_products.id) [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].

tables.business_process_overview: Tracks portfolio positions for wealth management, statement generation, and regulatory asset reporting.

columns.column_description: Links to fixed_customers.id for KYC status tracking [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
Current KYC verification state: 'verified', 'pending', or 'rejected' [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].

tables.business_process_overview: Stores compliance results ensuring onboarding meets AML/CTF regulations before product activation.

columns.column_description: Primary key identifying each loan contract [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
Funding or repayment account for the loan (accounts.id) [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
Loan product type (fixed_products.id) enabling rate and fee configuration [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].

tables.business_process_overview: Holds contractual data for credit facilities, supporting amortisation schedules, interest accrual, and risk provisioning.

columns.column_description: Unique identifier for the price snapshot [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Financial instrument (fixed_products.id) whose market price is captured [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Quoted price of the product as a decimal string [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].

tables.business_process_overview: Feeds valuation engines, margin calculations, and portfolio performance dashboards.

columns.column_description: Primary key for a customer order (e.g., securities trade) [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Placing customer (fixed_customers.id) [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Instrument or product being ordered (fixed_products.id) [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].

tables.business_process_overview: Captures customer instructions prior to execution, driving trade lifecycle and fulfilment workflows.

columns.column_description: Primary key for each payment record [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Account from/to which the payment is settled (accounts.id) [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Monetary value of the payment as numeric string [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].

tables.business_process_overview: Logs outgoing and incoming payments supporting reconciliation, treasury, and customer statements.

columns.column_description: Customer being assessed (fixed_customers.id) [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].
Numeric risk rating produced by internal or third-party models [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.2].

tables.business_process_overview: Supports credit, fraud, and marketing propensity decisions by quantifying customer risk.

columns.column_description: Primary key uniquely identifying each ledger movement [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
Account affected by the transaction (accounts.id) [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
Signed monetary amount of the transaction stored as string [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].
Date-time of posting in ISO-8601 format for chronological audit [Updated_financial_schema.pdf p.1].

tables.business_process_overview: Core ledger of money movements feeding balance calculations, fraud analytics, and regulatory reports.
